title: [Large-Scale] Collaborative Inquiry-Based Online Case Studies to Enhance Interdisciplinary Collaboration Competencies in Healthcare

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical knowledge and practical experience (intermediate expertise in medicine, radiobiology, and radiation physics)
context.additional_context: Online education designed to enhance collaborative problem-solving skills among diverse medical professionals, providing flexible learning environments through mobile devices and digital platforms

learning_goals: Through online case studies reflecting real clinical situations, learners can explain evidence-based treatment decision processes in collaboration with interdisciplinary team members.
Learners can understand the roles of physicians, radiobiologists, and radiation physicists in radiation therapy and apply effective communication strategies.
Learners can propose solutions to real-world problems arising in interdisciplinary collaboration through small-group activities and large-group discussions.

resources: Collaborative Online Learning Platform (Discussion/File Sharing Features)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
